data.description:
A Pebble watchface designed for office meetings. 

Keep track of the time that has passed without having to look at your wrist! Meeting subtly vibrates every 5 minutes and gives a distinctive double-vibrate every 15 minutes past the hour.

Meeting mode also has a very large and clear display of the minutes past the hour so it's easy to catch a glimpse of the time without being too obvious in an important meeting.

latest_release.release_notes: Update vibration patterns to make them a bit less loud and obtrusive during meetings.

data.title: Meeting mode

data.author: Nev Rawlins

changelog.release_notes: Adds support for Pebble 2 and required Pebble firmware v4.0.2 or later.
Reduced frame rate for animation to reduce impact on battery.   Should not notice animation performance reduction.

data.description:
A digital watchface in either 12 or 24 hour mode.  
  
The inspiration is the old game “Snake”.  In that game, as you control a snake around the screen, pixel blocks appear which you try to intercept. As your snake eats the blocks the snake gets longer and longer.
   
Here it is not a game, but when the minutes change, the snake starts at the top left corner and grows.  As it does this, it creates a negative of the current time using the one continuous line - hours at the top, minutes at the bottom, with the colon between.

As the snake's body is a continuous line, that does not touch itself, it cannot create central circles in numbers, so the numbers that normally have these lose part of one of the sides.  Look at the example screenshots to see how these are displayed: 0, 6, 8 and 9. 

Version 4.0 adds support for Pebble 2 and requires Pebble firmware v4.0.2 or later.

Screenshots: 
(1)  Animation (slower than the watchface), shows the snake creating 17:21.
(2) 12:59 
(3) 08:46
(4) 17:25 (24-hour)
(5) 08:52 (with Quick View)

Screenshots: 
(1)  Animation (slower than the watchface), shows the snake creating 17:21.
(2) 12:59 
(3) 08:46
(4) 09:01 (with Quick View)

Design created by Peter Fletcher from UK and originally appeared on the Tokyoflash Design Studio.  It is published with the designer's permission, and sanctioned by Tokyoflash.   

The original design can be found here: 
http://blog.tokyoflash.com/2011/12/05/snake-watch-slithers-onto-your-wrist/

latest_release.release_notes: Adds support for Pebble 2 and required Pebble firmware v4.0.2 or later.

data.title: Snake

data.description:
Shows the time in binary, four bits per time digit, in a grid layout.   

Time is shown in either 12- or 24-hour mode, as set in the watch settings.  

There is an "on-shake" animation to show the time (briefly) in more conventional fashion

data.description:
Sorta is a fuzzy time watchface (e.g., it shows "A little after eight fifteen in the evening in early March").  However, it shows fuzzy time slightly different than others.

Also, if you shake the watch, you'll see the exact time / date for a short time.  Just in case you need that.

...but you can use the settings page in the Pebble app on your mobile device to disable this shake-to-exact behavior, if you wish.

Finally, the battery percentage will appear in the top right if your battery is around 30% or less (or if you have it plugged in, so you can tell when it's fully charged).

[Update v1.2]
Minor updates/fixes for Pebble Time.

[Update v1.1]
Added ability to choose between a light and dark watchface.

Made some updates to the configuration options and squashed more bugs. More to come!
Added "Noon" and "Midnight". Tweaked some settings and fixed bugs pertaining to configuring the watchface features.
Fixed some bugs!
First release. Not sure if Pebble Time makes this obsolete but I figured I'd put it up!

changelog.release_notes: Version 3.70:  Day message can now customised to individual needs!  All what's needed is the long or short day name with the message.
Version 3.69: Reduced the number of characters displayed for location so the weather details can show correctly.
Version 3.68: Significant weather improvements!
Version 3.67: Weather improvements.
Version 3.66: Weather improvements.
Version 3.65: Master Key (pmkey.xyz) support now included.
Version 3.64: Weather improvements.
Version 3.63: Now available for Pebble Time 2!!
Version 3.62: Added option for manual weather location and other improvements.
Version 3.61: Weather improvements.
Version 3.60: Now available for Pebble 2!!
Version 3.52: Fixed a few more icon display bugs and other minor improvements.
Version 3.51:  Fixed a few display bugs and other minor improvements.

Version 3.50: NEW features added! 
- New-look configuration page 
- LIVE preview - options change directly on watch before pressing Save 
- Option to change date formats (UK & US style) 
- Option to vibrate when disconnected 
- Invert option now only shows in Classic Pebble and Pebble Steel
Version 3.01: Fixed problem of setting screen opening up at random occasions.
New version 3.0: Updated for Pebble Time Round!!  Also new-look configuration page and bug improvements.
Release version 2.0: Colours added!! Settings page now includes options to change background and foreground colours. Original Pebble users can still use the options to invert colours.
Minor release 1.01: Fixed vibration status as was not working properly.

data.description:
*** Also check out and install my new watchfaces, BEACON and Retro Digital! You'll love them as much as this one! ***
------------------------------------------------------------------------- 

Watchface which displays full date, time and weather status. Bluetooth icon which shows the phone is connected, and disappears when it is not. Vibrates with each connection status. Also, a different customised phrase for each day of the week!!  Includes a configuration menu to change temperature units from C to F, and to invert the screen. 
Added: Colour options, new-look configuration page with LIVE preview (options change on watch before pressing Save), date format and vibration options added, manual weather option and Master Key (pmkey.xyz) support.  Now updated for Pebble Time Round, Pebble 2 and Pebble Time 2.

Enjoy, and leave a heart!!

latest_release.release_notes: Version 3.70:  Day message can now customised to individual needs!  All what's needed is the long or short day name with the message.

data.description:
Simplicity watchface for Polish pebblers. Date and time is presented in Polish locale*. Watchface displays always in Polish**, regardless of Pebble language settings.

❤︎ Give it a GO, give it a HEART! ❤︎

Date format:
d. Month (Polish)

Time format:
H:mm (24h)
h:mm (12h)

*Font used on Simplicity watchface doesn't contain dot character '.' therefore a colon ':' is used as hours : minutes separator.

**Months are presented in nominative case. If you want months being displayed in genitive case, send me an email with the exact spelling for every month.

data.author: tr0tsky

changelog.release_notes: 1.0 Initial Release

data.description:
Time for a Game?

Displays the current time on a Tic Tac Toe grid. Time is shown in a Ternary format.

Left Column = 9 (3^2)
Middle Column = 3 (3^1)
Right Column = 1 (3^0)

Top Row = Hours
Middle Row = Minutes (Tens)
Bottom Row = Minutes (Ones)

If there's an X, you add the amount for that column. If there's an O you subtract the amount. If there's nothing, do nothing!

Add up all three values for a row to get the time.

First Screenshot = 3:24
Second Screenshot = 11:38
data.title: Tic-Tac-Ternary

data.description:
This is a Watchface inspired by "Material design" principles.
Its clean, minimal and unobtrusive.

The features include :
- It shows time in two sections for Hours and Minutes in contrasting colors.
- The change of time is animated.
- The screen refreshes with a smooth white-out, emanating from the first changed digit.
- The time digits reappear in two beautiful animations : "Slide" and "Scale". 
- Future updates WILL bring more animations and even more efficient battery consumption.

[Update 1.1] :
- Animation turned off when not charging and battery level drop to 50%.
- Animate Watchface on demand by tap/flick (even when battery level is below threshold).

If you have a comment or suggestion please feel free to write to me by "Email Developer for Support" option.

latest_release.release_notes:
Added Battery Level Controls :
- Animation turned off when battery level drop to 50 % and not charging.
- Tap/Flick to animate the watch-face on demand.

data.author: Cody Doremus

changelog.release_notes: Added additional color options for Making the top and bottom different backgrounds (they look pretty sweet)
Added two new date settings to use month abbreviations instead of numbers. ('Fe' vs ' 2')
Fixed transmission size issue between pebble and watch. Hopefully this makes it more reliable.
Added api key for openweathermap.org.
Fixed code that was not working with 2.3 release and causing the watchface to freeze when settings or colors updated. Hopefully fixed bug with weather icons sometimes going blank.
Changed update method for settings and color changes based on day/night. Should stop the freezing that started happening with the pebble 2.3 update.
Changed key for temperature communication. This should fix the temperature getting overridden to 0. Still looking for a bug that seems to only happen on a fresh load.

Bug fixes: Through working on an upcoming app I found I was not handling images correctly. Now I am properly checking to make sure I don't create the same image more than once and I only delete images that exist. Hopefully this fixes the behavior that sometimes instead of honoring a button press it stays on the watch and the temperature goes to 0 (I only saw this on the color version, but I am still doing things better now). I will continue to investigate if I manage to get that behavior again.
Big fix. I had some typos that were causing 1 or 2 open weather map icons to not show.
Centered date information. I think it looks a little better.

User request: added a setting to switch to Day-Month order on the date.

Menu icons and names are being adjusted so that my watchfaces are more easily identifiable. The shrunk screenshot is not super helpful if you are switching between the full to get more information and lite versions to save battery. The menu icon will now have the initials of the Precisioneer type (P for Precisioneer).
Spelling is hard...

Major Update! Now you can get a free API key for weather underground and vastly improve the quality of your weather reporting! To get your key go to: http://www.wunderground.com/weather/api/d/login.html More instructions are in the description of the settings page. You will see new icons when you use this free setting! If you do not have a key you will still get openweathermap.org weather. Majorly improved loading efficiency and memory usage by only loading images when they are needed. Improved the reliability of getting weather. The biggest failure was the phone not responding with a location, so now it will keep asking until it gets a response! Fixed a potential bug where you would get Celsius temperature even if you selected Fahrenheit.
Changed openweathermap request to high low temperature instead of day/night avg temp. Changed the day/night icon to red up arrow/down blue arrow. Updated menu icon with new layout, thought it is so small maybe that does not matter.

Added a battery charging icon.

Major overhaul of the calls to internet weather. Now it will not attempt an update if it did so in the last 17 minutes. It will attempt to update when the watchface is loaded and every 20 minutes (at 7, 27, and 47 minutes past the hour). This fixes a bug where weather was called multiple times in a row due to timing issues and should make the weather more reliable. Limiting the possible calls during the day also opens up the possibility for calling a more reliable weather provider... Stay tuned for an update.
Changed the name from the [apparently] trademark infringing "Pebleneer" to [hopefully] not law breaking "Precisioneer."
Shrunk icon to show the whole watchface instead of just the corner of the watchface. The text is a little sketchy, but hopefully it gets the point across.
Cleaned up double save of weather from a settings change. Updated menu screenshot.

Fixed a bug that the temperature reverted to C if updated from a settings change.
Added persistent weather, i.e. no more blank screens after the initial load! It will load last known good value. I originally thought you would come back hours later and the weather would be inaccurate, but I found it is common to go back and forth and sometimes the communication does not straiten out with the phone until the 30 minute update, so now it will load last known good value.

Fixed a missing "break" statement. Moved battery level text down a couple pixels to make it better centered with the icon.
Still crashes the first time it is loaded to the watch from the settings and weather websites being called at the same time...

Streamlined Phone to Watch communication.
Waiting to request first weather until java script on phone is ready. Hopefully this fixes the bug where sometimes the phone does not respond. If weather does not load, still check openweathermap.org as the free site sometimes does not respond, especially if you have been switching between screens and making a lot of requests with the same ip address. Please wait about 1 minute before retrying to give the website a chance to respond.

Still has the weird issue where it crashes due to the settings page being automatically called when the app is loaded... Need to investigate further.

data.description:
Data for those who need to know precisely how you want it. Configurable, because everyone is a little different and sometimes picky (see Engineer).
Use Pricisioneer COLOR for Pebble Time Watches!

Get a free api key to get UndergroundWeather! Instructions on settings page.
Otherwise use openweathermap.org

Settings must have an internet connection. Serial number is on the back of your watch. Thanks to Matt https://setpebble.com/ 

Seconds-because you like to be precise (or save battery by turning off)

No leading 0s for date and hours-because they are annoying. Pick Month-Day or Day-Month order.

Numerical Battery level-rounded to the nearest 10, and special charging icon.

Bluetooth status with custom short long short vibration for when it goes ??-So you realize you left your phone in the car or on your wireless charger

Choose Forecast on Left (or right) so you can plan what to wear. Current icon and temp in the center so you know what the outside is doing when you are far away from windows (UndergroundWeather "Feels like temperature").  Updated every 20 min. Temperature C or F (setting)

Current City-So you know where your phone thinks it is

Extra time data-A/P, year, or none

Customizable Day Abbreviation-English days not preferred? Need both letters to be capitalized?

Black or White Background that can invert at night

Monospaced Font-so all the text is in a predictable place. VCR_OSD_MONO by Riciery Leal

Give it a heart of you like it!

latest_release.release_notes: Added additional color options for Making the top and bottom different backgrounds (they look pretty sweet)

data.description:
A simple watchface using square dots to form the digits. Features: 
- Animated 
- 12/24 Hr Support (Set in pebble settings) 
- Date with Day of the Week 
- Battery Indicator 
- Vibrate on phone connect/disconnect
data.title: BigDotz

changelog.release_notes:

- Added a battery bar to the edge of the Lunar Industries logo
- Removed battery level until I can figure out a nicer way to implement it

- Adjusted layout
- Changed date format and increased text size
- Changed text size for battery level

- Added a better PNG for the Lunar Industries logo

data.description:
Introducing the Lunar Industries Watchface for Lunar Employees working on the Sarang Helium-3 mining station. The face includes the Lunar Industries logo, both 12 and 24 hour time support, and a helpful reminder to "trust robotic assist." stripe at the edge of the logo disappears to reflect the battery level.

Based off of the amazing movie "Moon" directed by Duncan Jones.

latest_release.release_notes:
- Added colour for Pebble Time and Pebble Time Steel
- Added a battery bar to the edge of the Lunar Industries logo

data.title: Lunar Industries

data.author: Marco Mans

changelog.release_notes:
Bugfix:
 - Settings are not correctly saved in watch
First release

data.description:
Check the progress of your current SabNZB downloads on your Pebble!!! 

The Watchfase has 2 states:
Idle - No active downloads
The watchface is showing the time with no unnecessary information

Active - There are active downloads
Above the time the number of downloads and the current download speed is shown. At the bottom a progressbar and the remaining downloadtime is shown.

Additional features: 
 * Vibration on new and/or completed download, 
 * Variable poll interval for Idle and Active state, 
 * Shake watch to update immediately when in Idle state.

This watchface contains the basic features at this moment. If there are enough fans, I will create new features, based on your suggestions! So please hearth it, if you like my watchface!

Used Font: "Capture it" by Magique Fonts (http://on.fb.me/1n3d8wh)

Ps. If you want to buy me a beer, please use the dontate-button in the settings window :)

latest_release.release_notes:
Bugfix:
 - Settings are not correctly saved in watch

data.title: SabFace

data.author: TFL
data.description: In many East African languages, the start of the daily time system is at dawn, not midnight. Thus, what would be seven o'clock in the morning in English becomes one o'clock in the morning in Swahili and other East African languages. This watchface is for those of you who are from East Africa or interested in learning something about the Swahili culture and language.
data.title: SWAHILI TIME DELUXE

data.author: Andy C
data.description: Based off a Pebble Time watch face
data.title: Basic Circle Analog

changelog.release_notes: Releasing Farenheit version

data.description:
** Farenheit Version **

A simple and elegant Watchface with custom numbers.  It displays the date (month and day), weather icon and temperature, and humidity percent.  

It also displays the watch battery, and shows a lightning icon when charging.  

Design - Andy Cooper ( http://www.potatomo.com ) 
Code - Marti Planellas ( http://www.martiplanellas.info )

data.author: Turner Vink

changelog.release_notes: - Fixed weather
- Switched to openweathermap.org for weather data

- Removed option to show/hide weather
- Weather now updates automatically every half hour

Glober Bold has been rebuilt from the ground up!
- Weather! See the current temperature and conditions either when you shake your Pebble or all the time
- Configuration! Spiffy new Slate config page, with options to show/hide battery and weather
- Fixed English localization not showing "charging" and "charged" strings
- Added colour support for Pebble Time and Pebble Time Steel
- Glober Bold now supports localization! The weekday now shows up in English, French, Spanish, and German!

- Added "Charged" status
- Added menu icon
- Added battery indicator with current percentage and "charging" status
- Adjusted spacing

- Fixed lack of unloading for custom fonts and destruction for TextLayers
- Tweaked the watchface so the time shows up without suttering
- Changed justification in order to keep spacing looking nice at all times in both 12h and 24h time

data.description: A simple watchface using the beautiful font Glober. See the time, date, battery level, and weather. The battery level can be hidden, and the weather can either be shown all the time or when you flick your wrist. The battery level changes colour as it charges/discharges.
data.title: Glober Bold

data.author: TomHol

changelog.release_notes: random colors on Pebble Time
switch to 1 minute update after 10 minutes.
Initial release

data.description: This is a homage to the first isometric dungeon Knight Lore on ZX Spectrum. The animated adventurer walks through a randomly generated dungeon. All sprite data including animations are taken from the Knight Lore source. Even with animations it conserves battery: After 60 seconds or when low on battery it switches off the animation. After 10 minutes it stops the movement but changes the room every minute. Anytime you can shake the watch and start the animation. Battery is shown as game lives, BT status is in the top left corner. the game: torinak.com/qaop#!knightlore image data: retrospec.sgn.net/users/nwalker/filmation/
data.title: Knight Lore Time

data.author: Ben Holfeld
data.description: A Real Smart Watch - A Smart Phrase Every time you look at your wrist. Don't just check time - check your Smart Watch!
data.title: Smart Watch

data.author: Gert Menke

changelog.release_notes: Fixed: Watchface did not redraw correctly when regaining focus, i.e. after notifications.
Now compatible with Pebble Time Round.

Bugfixes:
- Screen was always inverted for a brief moment on program start
- Invert display setting got lost on program start

Features:
- Antialiasing for Arcs on Basalt platform (Pebble Time)
- Colorful NoBT-Icons on Basalt platfom
- Separate options for battery indicator when charging/discharging

The watchface is still mostly b/w and I am not sure yet if I want to keep it that way. I need to play with my Pebble Time some more. A bit of color might be nice, especially with the bright background setting. We'll see.
Finally fixed the bug that broke the settings page.
New option: Small digital display. Allows for a slightly bigger hour hand.

Added option for hour arc vs. hour hand.
Slightly nicer default values.

New features:
- Indicator for Bluetooth connection (only visible when not connected)
- Vibrate on BT connection change
Added a subtle battery indicator.
Configuration page now remembers current settings.

Added a configuration page (not finished yet, but working).
New options:
- Invert colors
- Show/hide seconds (hide to save power)
- Show/hide digital time/date display
Use the current locale (as configured in the pebble settings) for week days.
Initial release

data.description:
A distinct arc for minutes, a small hour arc or hand that's clearly visible but does not distract from the minutes arc, and a subtle seconds display.

Additional features include a (subtle) battery indicator and a warning when the bluetooth connection is lost.

Feedback is welcome.
Want colors? Try Arc2!

latest_release.release_notes: Fixed: Watchface did not redraw correctly when regaining focus, i.e. after notifications.

data.author: Mark Bush

changelog.release_notes: Update to support new OpenWeather API format.
Improved connection to phone and weather info.
Completely redesigned for Pebble Time.  Uses colour gradient to indicate temperature.  Includes forecast below the watchface.  Displays current weather conditions in large colour background.
Added support for Chinese, Greek, Japanese and Cyrillic languages.  Updated weather icons and layout to improve time readability.

Added ability to hide/show temperature and weather conditions.

Added support for the following languages: Croatian, Czech, Danish, Dutch, English, Estonian, Finnish, French, German, Hungarian, Icelandic, Italian, Lithuanian, Norwegian, Polish, Portuguese, Romanian, Slovak, Slovenian, Spanish, Swedish, Turkish

Ensure config options are preserved when the watchface is reloaded.
Initial release for Weather Watch!

data.description:
Simple watchface with date and weather info. The hands are discreet on the outside so don't obscure the information being displayed.

Options are available for temperature units, whether to show temperature, weather, battery and bluetooth indicators, vibration alerts for when bluetooth disconnects, hourly or daily forecast and various options for the battery indicator.

Supports date in the following languages: Bulgarian, Byelorussian, Chinese, Croatian, Czech, Danish, Dutch, English, Estonian, Finnish, French, German, Greek, Hungarian, Icelandic, Italian, Japanese, Lithuanian, Norwegian, Polish, Portuguese, Romanian, Russian, Slovak, Slovenian, Spanish, Swedish, Turkish, Ukranian

latest_release.release_notes: Update to support new OpenWeather API format.

data.title: Weather Watch

changelog.release_notes: Added configurable color cycling and new colors! :D
Added configurable DOS version (date) format! :D
Updated for SDK 4.0 including Pebble 2 (Diorite) support! :D
[Pebble Time] Shake again during cursor blink to toggle display color! ;)
Added PWBIOS splash on load! :D
Vibration on Bluetooth disconnection + more! ;)
528 nm P1 phosphor green for Pebble Time users! :D
WHAT'S NEW popup lets you know what's new! ;D
Cursor now blinks only on shake to save battery! ;)
Improved energy efficiency of animation! :)
Added "DIR" animation as new minute ticks over. :D
Updated name.
Initial beta release.

data.description:
PW-DOS is a silly watchface for that small niche of individuals who enjoy modern wearable devices yet pine for the days of staring at a blinking command prompt.

Day and month are reflected in major and minor version numbers (or vice-versa if you prefer!), and the files' timestamp shows the current time.

latest_release.release_notes: Added configurable color cycling and new colors! :D

data.description:
Ascii pixel weather!

( ) clear
(#) partially cloudy
##  overcast
/// rain
/!/ thunder
**  snow
==  fog

- Multiple color themes: 
+ 14 color schemes (MSX blue, Atari red, Commodore brown, Pebble orange, DOS black, CGA tribute, DOS console, Terminal console, Turbo C IDE, Delphi IDE, Turbo Pascal, ...)
+ Random mode, color scheme changes every minute 
+ Color weather (Pebble Time) (smart and dynamic color scheme, check my COLOR WEATHER watchface for more information)

- Font style: 
+ Pixelated (original watchface design) 
+ Flat

- Weather temperature units option (C, F)
- Vibes on disconnect option
- Day of week (spanish or english)

data.description:
Band of bands

Band 1: Date (Day/Month order customizable)
Band 2: Battery charge (prefix +, while charging)
Band 3: Time (12h/24h as configured on Pebble)
Band 4: Bluetooth status (BT: connected / BT X: when disconnected)
Band 5: Weather condition and weather temperature (C,F,K unit customizable)

- Vibes on disconnect option
- Multiple themes
data.title: Band of bands

data.author: GG Crew

changelog.release_notes: Initial release.  Built via CloudPebble.net.

data.description:
Inspired by the Ishihara Color Test.
I have fond memories of these tests, always finding them fascinating.  When the Pebble Time was announced, this was the first project that came to mind.
It wasn't until I was a well into coding that I realized making a watchface that couldn't be read by people with specific forms of color-blindness was an unintentional bit of trolling...
Still, here it is!
data.title: Ishihara

data.description:
Simple, customizable watchface with splashes of color. Shows battery level with hour markers. Hour markers go green when charging.

Runs on both Pebble/Pebble Steel and Pebble Time/Time Steel.

Use the config page to adjust which features you want from:

- Show weekday/month
- Show day of the month
- Show dis/connected indicator (outer ring)
- Show battery level
- Show seconds hand

latest_release.release_notes:
v1.9:
- Fix config page title. Oops.

data.title: Thin

data.author: NiVZ
data.description:
My homage to 80's and 90's LCD watches that used shadows/hollows to create a 3D edged font effect.

Customisable settings allow you to:

- turn the Hollow3d font effect on or off
- invert the colours
- choose DD-MM or MM-DD date format 
- show or hide leading zeros on dates
- show or hide the Pebble logo

Many thanks to Orviwan for his help, support and feedback during development of my first watchface :)
data.title: Hollow3d

data.author: dezign999

changelog.release_notes: Raised tolerance for "annoying" your pebble. This would make it angry if shaken too many times. Will revert back to selected or random face afterwards and will not stay "angry" until next animation.
rewrite
chalk update
Updated Easter Egg tolerance. RAWR!!!
Updated Time watch Icon
Pebble Time update & new features
fixed initial date location
Initial release

data.description:
Introducing Smile64, the new update to Smile! Change your Pebble's mood to reflect your own, or set it to random and let it change moods on its own. Set your background color from one of the 64 available to coordinate with your watch, style or outfit! Flick you wrist to see the time and date.

Features
• Selectable Moods
• Random Moods
• Charge / BT Disconnect faces
• Color Selection

More moods to be added in future updates!

latest_release.release_notes: Raised tolerance for "annoying" your pebble. This would make it angry if shaken too many times. Will revert back to selected or random face afterwards and will not stay "angry" until next animation.

data.title: Smile

data.author: kvmet

changelog.release_notes:
1.7
Changed tick marks to be thicker.
Added battery indicator into the 12 o'clock tick mark (the middle of the tick mark becomes black as your battery drains)
Still working on a good way to include the date. If you have any suggestions, let me know. I might just put it next to the 3 o'clock tick mark, but I'd like it to be somehow put on there so it is visible even when the minute hand is covering it.
Tried adding minute indicators as suggested by many people: the "shade" effect makes them look bad because they are so small.
- Fixed midnight readout on 12 hour time.
- There was a problem at 8 o'clock where the image wasn't loading... It's fixed now!

- Fixed a crash w/ 24 hour time.
- Fixed time displaying wrong at midnight on 12 hour time.
- Improved memory usage.
- Changed name of app so that if it crashes, you will see 'Shade 1.4' instead of just 'Shade'
- I'm stupid and the hour conversion was wrong at noon. Fixed.

- Hopefully killed all these crashes
- Added bluetooth indicator

Hopefully fixed a crash.
Fixed app names on phone and watch.
Initial Release

data.description:
Only tells the time. Updates on the minute so that means great battery life to impress all of your friends.

- Works with 12 and 24 hour setting.
- A dot appears in the middle of the screen when Bluetooth is disconnected (see screenshots)
- NEW! Battery indicator embedded in the 12 O'clock tick mark.

If anyone has an idea for a clever way to include the date into this watch face: please send me an email and I'll credit you here!

latest_release.release_notes:
1.7
Changed tick marks to be thicker.
Added battery indicator into the 12 o'clock tick mark (the middle of the tick mark becomes black as your battery drains)
Still working on a good way to include the date. If you have any suggestions, let me know. I might just put it next to the 3 o'clock tick mark, but I'd like it to be somehow put on there so it is visible even when the minute hand is covering it.
Tried adding minute indicators as suggested by many people: the "shade" effect makes them look bad because they are so small.

data.title: Shade

data.description:
This simple quote of the day watchface is designed to let you wake up to an inspiring quote. Unlike other JavaScript watchfaces, since this app doesn't constantly update the main body (I have found the seconds makes little difference), battery life is normal.

Please don't hesitate to send me an email if you have found a bug or likewise.

Second screenshot shows accurate colors for when it's on the watch.

changelog.release_notes: Version 3.66: Significant weather improvements!
Version 3.65: Weather improvements.
Version 3.64: Weather improvements.
Version 3.63: Now available for Pebble 2 and Pebble Time 2!! Master Key (pmkey.xyz) support now included.
Version 3.62: Added option for manual weather location and other minor improvements.
Version 3.61: Weather improvements.
Version 3.60: Now available for Pebble 2!!

Version 3.50: NEW features added!
 - New-look configuration page
 - LIVE preview - options change directly on watch before pressing Save
 - Option to change date formats (UK & US style)
 - Option to vibrate when disconnected
 - Date displays the language chosen in user settings
 - Invert option now only shows in Classic Pebble and Pebble Steel
New version 3.0: Updated for Pebble Time Round!!  Also new-look configuration page and bug improvements.
Release version 2.0: Colours added!! Settings page now includes options to change background and foreground colours. Original Pebble users can still use the options to invert colours.

Release version 1.1: 

NEW configuration page to set the invert, display or hide seconds and choose C or F temperature units!

Moved AM/PM indicator and seconds to the left to center the time depending on the display options chosen.

data.description:
*** Also check out and install my new watchfaces, BEACON and Retro Digital! You'll love them as much as this one! ***
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
Inspired by the Illuminator watchfaces created at Facerepo for the Motorola Moto 360 smartwatch, I have created the Pebble version. Displays full time (with seconds that can be hidden), date and watch battery level. The am/pm indicator disappears with the 24 hour format. Weather location, temperature and conditions are also displayed, and updates every 30 minutes, or when the watchface is loaded, whichever is sooner. The bluetooth icon serves as the connection indicator. It disappears when disconnected. Vibrations with each connection status.
Added: Colour options, new-look configuration page with LIVE preview (options change on watch before pressing Save), date format and vibration options added, invert, manual weather option and Master Key (pmkey.xyz) support.  Now updated for Pebble Time Round, Pebble 2 and Pebble Time 2.
Enjoy, and leave a heart!!
data.title: Moto 360 Illuminator Pro

data.author: Nev Rawlins

data.description:
A digital watchface in 12-hour or 24-hour format, depending on the watch settings.

The idea for this watch was inspired by honeycomb, as the name suggests, with information displayed in the hexagonal cells. 

The time is shown in the 2 pairs of large cells – top two showing hours, bottom two minutes.

Additional cells show:
- Day, day of month and month in the top 3 cells
- Battery level in the large cell bottom left
- Bluetooth connection in the bottom right cell
- In 12-hour format, 1 small cell near the hours shows A (am) or P (pm)
- Remaining small cells  randomly show as empty or full

Configuration enables choice of three background colors:
 - Black 
 - Blue
 - Red

When Quick View appears, the day of the month is shown with the time.

The example screenshots show:  
(1) 7:28AM Saturday 26 October, 90% battery, 12-hour
(2) 12:34 Saturday 26 October, 60% battery, 24-hour, no bluetooth 
(3) 3:38PM Sunday 07 June, 20% battery, 12-hour
(4) 9:23PM Wednesday 10 June, 70% battery, 12-hour
(5) 19:44 (with Quick View) 

Design created by Peter Fletcher and taken from the Tokyoflash Design Studio.  This watchface is published with the designer's permission, and sanctioned by Tokyoflash.   

The original design can be found here: 
http://blog.tokyoflash.com/2012/02/14/honeycomb-lcd-watch-2-ways-to-tell-the-time/
